title: SS.PT.456
prompt: Which of the following statements can be inferred from the excerpts?
feedback: Because only Congress has the power to raise an army and declare war, one can infer that the President must ask Congress before using the military - especially in times of war. Since World War II, the president has used the military for war-like activity several times. Most notably, Congress never declared war in Vietnam, however the U.S. military fought communist forces there from 1965-1973 - twice as long as World War II. Congress passed the War Powers Act that gave the president the ability to wage war without a declaration of war.
